item.title: Scarebellum add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Skeptical scrutiny is the means, in both science and religion, by which deep thoughts can be winnowed from deep nonsense." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Scarebellum add a quote by Richard Buckminster Fuller
item.description: "Everyone is born a genius, but the process of living de-geniuses them." -- Richard Buckminster Fuller

item.title: Scarebellum add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "Man has gone long enough, or even too long, without being man enough to face the simple truth that the trouble with man is man." -- James Thurber

item.title: Scarebellum add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Life is full of misery, loneliness, and suffering - and it's all over much too soon." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Scarebellum add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Scarebellum add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I'd take the awe of understanding over the awe of ignorance any day." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Scarebellum add a quote by Douglas Adams
Scarebellum add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Scarebellum add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "The greatest fine art of the future will be the making of a comfortable living from a small piece of land." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Scarebellum add a quote by Edward Gorey
item.description: "I really think I write about everyday life. I don't think I'm quite as odd as others say I am. Life is intrinsically, well, boring and dangerous at the same time. At any given moment the floor may open up. Of course, it almost never does; that's what makes it so boring." -- Edward Gorey
